page.title: 15FARLEY HAMLET
page.content: Farley is a small hamlet consisting of a few council dwellings but in the main,stone built detatched houses. Farley Hall is a large half timbered house built in 1607. It has been renovated and restored by its present owner,Mr.Antony Bamford,of J.C.B Excavators Ltd.,Rocester. Mr.Bamford employs a butler,a nanny,a cook,maids,a groom and gardeners,somewhat unusual in this day and age.Instead of travelling to work by horse and carriage,however, he uses a helicopter.The properties in the old village are owned by Mr.Bamford. Some are in the process of being renovated."Home Farm" is now a stud farm breeding Arabs.The old farm house is a British craft shop open only to foreign vistors to J.C.B. The old Smithy has been restored and is of historical interest. The tiny village shop closed in 1945.
